page.title: 02LANDSCAPE WEST OF KEMPSFORD
page.content: The landscape is flat with no hills. It is cultivated farmland enclosed by hedges. There is no dry-stone walling.The hedges are mainly hawthorne and blackthorne with some elder and a few trees - generally ash- scattered along the line of the hedge. Willows grow alongside the wet meadows adjacent to the{River Thames and also where the{Thames and Severn {canal}used to traverse the area. Small clumps of such trees identifying where farmers have not infilled the canal. The fields tend to be large, staight sided, where hedges and fences have been removed to create larger, simpler cereal growing units.
